item.title: First Blog Post!
item.description: Before PERMANOVA was created and MANOVAs always violated assumptions: library(vegan) ## Loading required package: permute ## Loading required package: lattice ## This is vegan 2.5-6 library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.2.1 ✓ purrr 0.3.3 ## ✓ tibble 2.1.3 ✓ dplyr 0.8.4 ## ✓ tidyr 1.0.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.3.1 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ───── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() dists<-iris%>%select(Sepal.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have recently completed: Relationships between State Education & Mental Health Budgets and Poverty & Graduation Rates Avocado Price Patterns

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Modeling 0. (5 pts) Introduce your dataset and each of your variables (or just your main variables if you have lots) in a paragraph. What are they measuring? How many observations? avo<-read.csv("avocado.csv") avo%>%head ## AveragePrice Total.Volume X4046 X4225 X4770 type region ## 1 1.33 64236.62 1036.74 54454.85 48.16 conventional Albany ## 2 0.99 386100.49 292097.36 27350.92 297.90 conventional Atlanta ## 3 1.17 596819.40 40450.49 394104.02 17353.79 conventional BaltimoreWashington ## 4 0.

item.title: Project_1
item.description: library(plyr) library(tidyverse) library(plotly) library(cluster) library(psych) GradRates17<-read.csv("State_Grad_Rates_2017.csv") Poverty17<-read.csv("State_Poverty_2017.csv") Budget17<-read.csv("State_Budget_2017.csv") For the year of 2017, I have compiled 3 different datasets, comparing each of the states in the US. The first, entitled GradRates17, encompasses the graduation rate, Poverty17 holds the number of poverty cases and the total population of each state, and Budget17 contains the total budget, budget towards mental health care, and budget towards education.
